column1: 2$Condition: Bipolar Depression$3/21/2012 3:38:37 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"easy to use
column3: still able to ""feel"". Best medication I've used. I take this and Effexor."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I have been on Lamictal for 8 years. I started it for mild seizures. It works. I also notice I am less anxious. I have no side effects. It does not change my thinking
column3: as a anti-depressant would. I still have to work on my ""stuff"" baggage. It slows me down enough to do that.it is not a miracle drug. It does not numb you
column4: you must do the work. Several of my friends with Bi-Polar are also on it with success. "

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$

55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$2$5$I am on my second week with this medication. Perhaps this isn't long enough. I find that I am having mood swings. Dr. never said I was bipolar. Since adding it to my other meds at night I am sleeping solid but have a hard time shaking it off in the morning.

column1: 6$Condition: Bipolar Depression$5/13/2011 1:56:06 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  (Patient) $4$4$5$I am on this and a combination of 4 other drugs. It's the best thing i have been on yet. I dont feel so overwhlemed by my emotions or just rage out over little things. I feel normal i have energy and am sleeping much better. I think it works great.
7$Condition: Bipolar Depression$1/1/2011 11:11:20 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$1$5$I have been on this med for about 2 mos.  Have not seen any improvement
column3: symptoms seem to be increasing.   It is very easy to use and does not leave an after taste
column5: don't feel benefit is worth continuing.

column1: 8$Condition: Bipolar Depression$12/22/2010 12:47:44 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been on this medication for about 6 weeks now. I am so glad that I am. I haven't been cycling
column2: or depressed since about week 2. I am still able to feel really happy
column5: with sufficient reason. But they are rational reactions rather than me just going off into a cycling mood without cause.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$2$4$I still am have these bad mood swings I guess they call them Highs and lows. I have never been dignosed with bipolar I do have a.d.d and im on adderall
column3: celexa and Lamotrigine(generic for Lamictal) I have been gambling lately and I have always had spending problems. in reading the signs and symptoms I can't believe all the symptoms I have. I guess I should make an appt. with a physic I see a Med Dr. for my Meds and we talk briefly 5 to 10 mins. inappropiate sexual activity

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$5$5$This medicine is for my daughter that just turned 13th at the end of April. She has Autism and ADHD and has been having seizures and the doctors don't know why. When they run the test nothing shows up but this medicine works really good for her. She is even doing better in school. The only bad thing is it cost so much money and have to keep fighting insurance company to get it
